see notes m1l make 1 left - see notes instructions with 2 5 mm needles loosely cast on 56 sts using knitted cast-on method or a stretchy cast-on if you prefer pm and join in round knit 4 rnds switch to 2 75mm needles and begin colorwork chart go slowly to keep the gauge nice and bouncy colorwork chart = catch float start here solstice mittens switch back to smaller needles 2 5mm knit 2 rnds thumb gusset set-up round for thumb gusset k7 sts pm k1 m1r k1 m1l k1 pm knit to end of round knit 3 rnds increase round k to marker slm m1r k to 1 st before marker m1l slm knit to end of round next 3 rnds knit continue in this way knitting an increase round followed by 3 knit rounds until there are 17 sts between markers place sts between markers on waste yarn cast on 3 sts using backward loop method continue knitting until mitten reaches 1 75 or 4 5 cm above thumb gusset optional decrease round for a snug fit *k2tog k12* to end of round 4 sts decreased cast off using knitted cast-off method or with another method if you prefer thumb pick up the 17 sts on waste yarn with two dpns ndl 1 ndl 2 with ndl 3 pick up bar in gap twist and place on ndl 2 continuing with ndl 3 pick up 3 sts from edge at top of thumb gusset then pick up bar in gap twist it and knit pm next round knit to last 2 sts on ndl 2 k2tog k 3 sts on ndl 3 sl last st from ndl 3 to ndl 1 k2tog with next st now there are 20 sts on ndls redistribute sts evenly among needles and knit until thumb measures 1 38 inches 3 5 cm or until desired length cast off with knitted cast-off notes weave in ends and block m1r make 1 left -
